isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION, TANDEM AXLES: SPICER J400-S, W460-S - ASSEMBLE - DIFFERENTIAL

step1.para: If ring gear was removed from differential case, re-install at this time. Use hydraulic press and suitable riveting fixture as shown in Figure 109. Pressure requirement per rivet is 45 to 50 U.S. tons (41 to 45 metric tons).

note.para: Ring gear and pinion must be replaced as a matched set only.

step1.para: Install bearing cones to differential case halves. Place bearing cups on cones during remainder of assembly to prevent damage to bearings ( Figure 110).

figure.caption: Figure 109. Place Bearing Cups on Cones

note.para: Use of press and proper adapter is required to eliminate possible damage to bearings.

step1.para: Apply a small amount of lubricant to all mating surfaces. This will keep thrust washers in place during assembly and provide initial lubrication.
Place thrust washer and side gear in left hand differential case ( Figure 111).

figure.caption: Figure 110. Place Thrust Washer and Side Gear in Left Hand Differential Case

step1.para: Assemble differential pinions and thrust washers on cross shaft. Place assembly in flange half differential case ( Figure 112).

figure.caption: Figure 111. Assemble Differential Pinions and Thrust Washers on Cross Shaft

step1.para: Place remaining side gear and thrust washers in position on differential pinions ( Figure 113).

figure.caption: Figure 112. Place Remaining Side Gear and Thrust Washers in Position on Differential Pinions

step1.para: Assemble case halves, making sure match marks are lined up ( Figure 114).

note.para: If case halves were not match marked, align the quadrants that have the three machined holes.

step1.para: Install differential case bolts and nuts. Tighten alternately and evenly to 115 to 135 ft-lbs. (156 to 183 Nm) in the J Model carriers and 160 to 185 ft-lbs. (217 to 251 Nm) in the W Model carriers ( Figure 115).

figure.caption: Figure 114. Install Differential Case Bolts and Nuts

note.para: Differential case bolts and nuts can be tightened after installation into the carrier housing, prior to backlash adjustment.
